019package org.jgrapes.core.internal;
020
021import java.util.ArrayDeque;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.Iterator;
024import java.util.Queue;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedDeque;
027import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
031import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
032
033/**
034 * This class provides the default implementation of an {@link EventPipeline}.
035 */
036@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
037public class EventProcessor implements InternalEventPipeline, Runnable {
038
039    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.FieldNamingConventions")
040    protected static final ThreadLocal<EventBase<?>> newEventsParent
041        = new ThreadLocal<>();
042
043    private final ExecutorService executorService;
044    private final ComponentTree componentTree;
045    private final EventPipeline asEventPipeline;
046    protected final Queue<EventChannelsTuple> queue = new ArrayDeque<>();
047    private Iterator<HandlerReference> invoking;
048    // Used by this thread only.
049    private Set<EventBase<?>> suspended = new HashSet<>();
050    // Only this thread can remove, but others might add.
051    private Queue<EventBase<?>> toBeResumed = new ConcurrentLinkedDeque<>();
052    private boolean isExecuting;
053    private ThreadLocal<Thread> executor = new ThreadLocal<>();
054
055    /**
056     * Instantiates a new event processor.
057     *
058     * @param tree the tree
059     */
060    /* default */ EventProcessor(ComponentTree tree) {
061        this(tree, Components.defaultExecutorService());
062    }
063
064    /* default */ EventProcessor(ComponentTree tree,
065            ExecutorService executorService) {
066        this.componentTree = tree;
067        this.executorService = executorService;
068        asEventPipeline = new CheckingPipelineFilter(tree, this);
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Gets the component tree.
073     *
074     * @return the component tree
075     */
076    protected ComponentTree tree() {
077        return componentTree;
078    }
079
080    /* default */ EventPipeline asEventPipeline() {
081        return asEventPipeline;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Called before adding completion events. The parent of
086     * a completion event is not the event that has completed but
087     * the event that generated the original event.
088     *
089     * @param parent the new parent
090     */
091    /* default */ void updateNewEventsParent(EventBase<?> parent) {
092        newEventsParent.set(parent);
093    }
094
095    @Override
096    public <T extends Event<?>> T add(T event, Channel... channels) {
097        ((EventBase<?>) event).generatedBy(newEventsParent.get());
098        ((EventBase<?>) event).processedBy(this);
099        synchronized (this) {
100            EventChannelsTuple.addTo(queue, event, channels);
101            if (!isExecuting) {
102                // Queue was initially empty, this starts it
103                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
104                isExecuting = true;
105                executorService.execute(this);
106            }
107        }
108        return event;
109    }
110
111    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConfusingTernary")
112    /* default */ void add(Queue<EventChannelsTuple> source) {
113        synchronized (this) {
114            while (true) {
115                EventChannelsTuple entry = source.poll();
116                if (entry == null) {
117                    break;
118                }
119                entry.event.processedBy(this);
120                queue.add(entry);
121            }
122            if (!isExecuting) {
123                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
124                isExecuting = true;
125                executorService.execute(this);
126            }
127        }
128    }
129
130    @Override
131    public void merge(InternalEventPipeline other) {
132        if (!(other instanceof BufferingEventPipeline)) {
133            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
134                "Can only merge events from an BufferingEventPipeline.");
135        }
136        add(((BufferingEventPipeline) other).retrieveEvents());
137    }
138
139    @Override
140    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidDeeplyNestedIfStmts",
141        "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
142    public void run() {
143        String origName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
144        try {
145            Thread.currentThread().setName(
146                origName + " (P" + Components.objectId(this) + ")");
147            executor.set(Thread.currentThread());
148            componentTree.setDispatchingPipeline(this);
149            while (true) {
150                // No lock needed, only this thread can remove from resumed
151                var resumedEvent = toBeResumed.poll();
152                if (resumedEvent != null) {
153                    if (suspended.remove(resumedEvent)) {
154                        resumedEvent.invokeWhenResumed();
155                        invokeHandlers(resumedEvent.clearSuspendedHandlers(),
156                            resumedEvent);
157                    }
158                    continue;
159                }
160
161                EventChannelsTuple next;
162                synchronized (this) {
163                    next = queue.poll();
164                    if (next == null) {
165                        // Everything is done, though suspended handlers
166                        // may cause this processor to be reactivated.
167                        GeneratorRegistry.instance().remove(this);
168                        isExecuting = false;
169                        synchronized (executor) {
170                            executor.notifyAll();
171                        }
172                        break;
173                    }
174                }
175                HandlerList handlers
176                    = componentTree.getEventHandlers(next.event, next.channels);
177                invokeHandlers(handlers.iterator(), next.event);
178            }
179        } finally {
180            // This processor should now only be (strongly) referenced
181            // from suspended events (if any exist), the
182            // CheckingPipelineFilter (which is only referenced from this)
183            // and some component tree, if this is the tree's default
184            // processor.
185            newEventsParent.set(null);
186            componentTree.setDispatchingPipeline(null);
187            executor.set(null);
188            Thread.currentThread().setName(origName);
189        }
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Invoke all (remaining) handlers with the given event as parameter.
194     *
195     * @param handlers the handlers
196     * @param event the event
197     */
198    private void invokeHandlers(Iterator<HandlerReference> handlers,
199            EventBase<?> event) {
200        try {
201            invoking = handlers;
202            newEventsParent.set(event);
203            // invoking may be set to null by suspendHandling()
204            while (invoking != null && invoking.hasNext()) {
205                HandlerReference hdlr = invoking.next();
206                try {
207                    if (event.isStopped()) {
208                        break;
209                    }
210                    hdlr.invoke(event);
211                } catch (AssertionError t) {
212                    // JUnit support
213                    CoreUtils.setAssertionError(t);
214                    event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
215                } catch (Error e) { // NOPMD
216                    // Wouldn't have caught it, if it was possible.
217                    throw e;
218                } catch (Throwable t) { // NOPMD
219                    // Errors have been rethrown, so this should work.
220                    event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
221                }
222            }
223        } catch (AssertionError t) {
224            // JUnit support
225            CoreUtils.setAssertionError(t);
226            event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
227        } catch (Error e) { // NOPMD
228            // Wouldn't have caught it, if it was possible.
229            throw e;
230        } catch (Throwable t) { // NOPMD
231            // Errors have been rethrown, so this should work.
232            event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
233        } finally { // NOPMD
234            if (invoking != null) {
235                event.handled();
236                invoking = null;
237                newEventsParent.get().decrementOpen();
238            }
239        }
240    }
241
242    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CompareObjectsWithEquals")
243    /* default */ void suspendHandling(EventBase<?> event) {
244        if (Thread.currentThread() != executor.get()) {
245            throw new IllegalStateException("May only be called from handler.");
246        }
247        if (!invoking.hasNext()) {
248            // Last anyway, nothing to be done
249            return;
250        }
251        event.setSuspendedHandlers(invoking);
252        invoking = null;
253        suspended.add(event);
254        // Just in case (might happen)
255        toBeResumed.remove(event);
256    }
257
258    /* default */ void resumeHandling(EventBase<?> event) {
259        toBeResumed.add(event);
260        synchronized (this) {
261            if (!isExecuting) {
262                // There were no more events, restart
263                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
264                isExecuting = true;
265                executorService.execute(this);
266            }
267        }
268    }
269
270    /*
271     * (non-Javadoc)
272     * 
273     * @see org.jgrapes.core.internal.InternalEventPipeline#executorService()
274     */
275    @Override
276    public ExecutorService executorService() {
277        return executorService;
278    }
279
280    @Override
281    public void awaitExhaustion() throws InterruptedException {
282        synchronized (executor) {
283            while (isExecuting) {
284                executor.wait();
285            }
286        }
287    }
288
289    /*
290     * (non-Javadoc)
291     * 
292     * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
293     */
294    @Override
295    public String toString() {
296        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
297        builder.append(Components.objectName(this))
298            .append(" [");
299        if (queue != null) {
300            builder.append("queue=")
301                .append(queue);
302        }
303        builder.append(']');
304        return builder.toString();
305    }
306
307}
